oai_dc:dc.dc:title: 1868 edition of "The Mystery Finished: The Negro Has a Soul"
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Published in Memphis (Tenn." the author of this volume never identifies himself. The treatise is an odd conflation of Old Testament exegesis and the recent history of the civil war in "Jephatic Israel" or America. The subtitle is: "His normal relation is that of a servant of tribute to Shem and Japheth. The Negro is not a citizen of the state, but a member of the Church by divine appointment" He argues that the Sons of Ham--an Old Testament reference--cannot be equal to descendants of other sons of Noah.
